item.title: Pinning Down Proline-Directed Phosphorylation Signaling
item.description: Notes on a 2002 Trends in Cell Biology review introducing phosphorylation-specific prolyl isomerization as a novel signaling mechanism. Pin1-mediated cis-trans switching of pSer/Thr-Pro motifs acts as a conformational timer for cellular signaling, impacting activity, interactions, and localization of key regulatory proteins.

item.title: Regulatory Modules: Coupling Protein Stability to Phosphorylation during Cell Division
item.description: Notes on 2012 FEBS Review about how phosphorylation controls protein stability via phosphodegrons and phospho-inhibited degrons, integrating ubiquitin-mediated degradation in cell cycle regulation.

item.title: Mechanism of CDK Activation Revealed by the Structure of a CyclinA-CDK2 Complex
item.description: Notes on a 1995 Nature paper revealing the structural mechanism of CDK2 activation by cyclinA, focusing on key conformational changes that relieve autoinhibition and organize the catalytic site.
